statements: SELECT * FROM Customers ORDER BY customer_id DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT name, age FROM Customers WHERE gender = 'Male'
SELECT DISTINCT gender FROM Customers
SELECT * FROM Customers ORDER BY age ASC
SELECT name, purchase_history FROM Customers
SELECT * FROM Customers WHERE age > 25 ORDER BY name ASC, age DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT name, age FROM Customers WHERE gender = 'Female' ORDER BY age ASC, name DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT customer_id, name, gender FROM Customers WHERE purchase_history LIKE '%shoes%' ORDER BY customer_id DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT * FROM Customers WHERE age BETWEEN 30 AND 40 ORDER BY age DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT name, age, purchase_history FROM Customers WHERE age < 30 AND name LIKE 'J%' ORDER BY name ASC, age ASC LIMIT 5
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, age, city FROM customers WHERE gender='Male';
SELECT customer_name, gender, city FROM customers ORDER BY age DESC;
SELECT customer_name, age, city FROM customers WHERE city='New York' AND age > 30;
SELECT customer_name, purchase_date, product_name, amount FROM purchase_history WHERE amount > 100 ORDER BY purchase_date DESC;
SELECT customer_name, age FROM customers WHERE gender = 'Male' ORDER BY age DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT customer_name, city FROM customers WHERE age < 30 AND city IN ('New York', 'Los Angeles') ORDER BY city ASC, age DESC;

SELECT customer_name, purchase_date, product_name, amount FROM customers JOIN purchase_history ON customers.customer_id = purchase_history.customer_id WHERE amount > 100 ORDER BY purchase_date ASC LIMIT 10;
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(purchase_id) AS num_purchases FROM purchase_history GROUP BY customer_id HAVING num_purchases > 5 ORDER BY num_purchases DESC;
SELECT AVG(age) AS average_age, AVG(amount) AS average_amount FROM customers JOIN purchase_history ON customers.customer_id = purchase_history.customer_id;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, age, city FROM customers WHERE age > 30;
SELECT customer_name, age, city FROM customers ORDER BY age DESC;
SELECT customer_name, income, marital_status FROM customers JOIN demographics ON customers.customer_id = demographics.customer_id;
SELECT customer_name, purchase_date, total_amount FROM customers JOIN purchases ON customers.customer_id = purchases.customer_id ORDER BY purchase_date ASC;
SELECT customer_name, age, city FROM customers WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY city ASC;
SELECT customer_name, gender, city FROM customers WHERE gender = 'Female' ORDER BY customer_name DESC;
SELECT customer_name, age, total_amount FROM customers JOIN purchases ON customers.customer_id = purchases.customer_id WHERE total_amount > 1000 ORDER BY total_amount DESC;
SELECT customer_name, education_level, income FROM customers JOIN demographics ON customers.customer_id = demographics.customer_id WHERE income > 50000 ORDER BY income DESC;
SELECT customer_name, age, product FROM customers JOIN purchases ON customers.customer_id = purchases.customer_id WHERE purchase_date >= '2022-01-01' ORDER BY purchase_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM Customers;
SELECT name, age, gender FROM Customers ORDER BY age DESC;
SELECT customer_id, gender, location FROM Customers WHERE age > 30;
SELECT * FROM PurchaseHistory WHERE price > 100;
SELECT campaign_name, budget, start_date, end_date FROM AdvertisingCampaigns ORDER BY budget DESC;
SELECT * FROM Customers WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY name DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT customer_id, name, age, location FROM Customers WHERE gender='Female' ORDER BY age ASC;
SELECT c.name, p.product_name, p.price FROM Customers c JOIN PurchaseHistory p ON c.customer_id = p.customer_id WHERE p.price > 100 ORDER BY p.price DESC, c.name;
SELECT * FROM Demographics WHERE income BETWEEN 50000 AND 80000 AND education_level='Graduate';
SELECT d.customer_id, d.income, c.campaign_name FROM Demographics d JOIN AdvertisingCampaigns c ON d.customer_id = c.campaign_id WHERE c.budget > 5000 ORDER BY d.income DESC, c.start_date ASC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT name, gender, location FROM customers WHERE age > 30;
SELECT customer_id, name, age, gender FROM customers WHERE gender='Male';
SELECT * FROM purchase_history ORDER BY total_amount DESC;
SELECT customer_id, purchase_date, total_amount FROM purchase_history WHERE category='Electronics';
SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY name ASC, age DESC;
SELECT name, age, location FROM customers WHERE gender='Female' AND age > 30;
SELECT customer_id, name, purchase_date, total_amount FROM customers INNER JOIN purchase_history ON customers.customer_id = purchase_history.customer_id;
SELECT customer_id, name, age, location, category FROM customers LEFT JOIN purchase_history ON customers.customer_id = purchase_history.customer_id WHERE total_amount > 1000;
SELECT c.name, d.ethnicity, d.income, c.location FROM customers c INNER JOIN demographics d ON c.customer_id = d.customer_id WHERE d.income >= 50000;
